author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector A. Saravanavelraj here on Wednesday inaugurated the mobile service centre for voters to create awareness among the voters of the need to exercise their franchise.

It will also receive forms for deletion or inclusion of voters in the voters’ list. The mobile van with officials will visit the villages on all working days up to April 15.

Upon receiving forms, the officials will verify the veracity of the claims on the spot with the applicants. If their claims are found to be true, the officials will process the applications so as to include or delete in the voters list.

Inaugurating the mobile unit, Mr. Saravanavelraj said it was one among the innovative steps taken by the Election Commission to increase awareness of the importance of excising the democratic right.

Moreover, it enabled voters to include names in the voters list at their doorsteps. The unit would function from 10 am to 5 pm. The voters should use the opportunity for including their names in the voters list. Besides it, voters’ service centres had been functioning at seven places in the district including Collectorate, Revenue Divisional Offices and taluk offices.
title: Last chance to include names in poll rolls
